00030 //  Short summary of classes involved:
00031 //   The hanger for kernel fitting data is called KernelFit.
00032 //  it contains among dozens of items a vector of Kernels  (vector<Kernel>).
00033 // Since Kernel's are in double precision, they are NOT derived from Image's
00034 // but from a new type DImage (it seemed to render things rather complicated
00035 // to turn Image into a template class (on the pixel type used for calculations)).
00036 // So in the end we have :
00037 #ifdef JUST_FOR_DOCUMENTATION
00038 
00039    class KernelFit { 
00040    vector<Kernel> Kernels; 
00041    BestImageStampList *StampList;
00042    ...
00043    };
00044 
00045 #endif
00046 
00047 #include <vector>
00048 
00049 struct XYPower  /* to handle and compute things like x**n*y**m */
00050 {  /* was separated from other stuff because we need 2 of them : one for the spatial variations of the kernel,
00051    and one for the spatial variation of the background (see in OptParams) */
00052   int Degree, Nterms;
00053   int *Xdeg;  //[Nterms]  : values of x exponant of monomials
00054   int *Ydeg; //[Nterms]   : values of exponant for x and y of monomials
00055 
00056   /* the value of monomial of rank q (where q < Nterms) */
00057   double Value(const double X, const double Y, const int q) const;
00058 
00059   /* default constructor: Value(x,y,0) will return 1. */
00060   XYPower() { Xdeg=Ydeg = NULL; SetDegree(0);};
00061   XYPower(int Degree) { Xdeg=Ydeg = NULL; SetDegree(Degree);};
00062   void SetDegree(const int Degree);
00063 
00064   ~XYPower() { if (Xdeg) delete [] Xdeg; if (Ydeg) delete [] Ydeg;}
00065 
00066 };
00067 
00068 
00069 class OptParams {
00070 public :
00071   int HKernelSize; /*  actual size = 2*HKernelSize+1 */
00072 
00073   /* kernel basis */
00074   int NGauss;
00075   double *Sigmas;// [NGauss]
00076   int *Degrees; // [NGauss]
00077   double NSig; // size (in pixel) of kernel in number of sigmas of guessed size.
00078 
00079   /* Kernel variations */
00080   XYPower KernVar;
00081 
00082   /* background */
00083   XYPower BackVar;
00084 
00085   int HStampSize;
00086 
00087   int MaxStamps;
00088 
00089   OptParams(); /* default values */
00090   void OptimizeSizes(double BestSeeing, double WorstSeeing);
00091   void OptimizeSpatialVariations(const int NumberOfStars);
00092   int StampSize() const { return 2*HStampSize+1;}
00093   /* DOCF returns the size of the convolved stamps */
00094   int   ConvolvedSize() const { return 2*(HStampSize - HKernelSize) + 1;}
00095 
00096 };
00097

00099 /* The actual hanger for kernel fit data */
00100 
00102 class KernelFit {
00103 
00104   public :
00106   const Image *BestImage; 
00107 
00108   const Image *WorstImage; 
00109 
00110   double BestImageBack;
00112   double WorstImageBack;
00114   double SkyVarianceWorstImage;
00116   double WorstImageGain;
00117 
00119   double KernAtCenterSum; 
00120   vector<Kernel> Kernels; 
00121 
00122 
00123   StampList  *BestImageStamps;
00124 
00126   Image *ConvolvedBest; 
00127   DImage* convolutions;  
00128   DImage* backStamps;  
00129   OptParams optParams;
00130 
00131   int HKernelSizeX() { return optParams.HKernelSize;}
00132   int HKernelSizeY() { return optParams.HKernelSize;}
00133 
00134   int mSize; /* the size of the matrix m */
00135   int backStart; /* where are the indices corresponding to differential background coefficients */
00136   double *m; 
00137   double *b; 
00138   double *solution; //[mSize]/* the weights of various kernels */
00139 
00140 /* routines to compute an index in the solution array ... internal cooking */
00141 
00142   int KernIndex(int iKernel, int iSpatial) const { return optParams.KernVar.Nterms*iKernel + iSpatial;};
00143   int BackIndex(int ib) const { return ib+Kernels.size()*optParams.KernVar.Nterms;}
00144 
00145 
00146 /* fitted differential background value */
00147 double BackValue(const double&x, const double &y) const ; 
00148 
00149  void DeleteConvolvedBest() { if (ConvolvedBest) delete ConvolvedBest; ConvolvedBest = NULL;}
00150 
00151     KernelFit() { BestImage = WorstImage = NULL; BestImageStamps = NULL; ConvolvedBest = NULL; 
00152                        m = b = solution = NULL; convolutions = NULL;
00153                        BestImageBack = WorstImageBack = 0;
00154                       }
00155 
00156   ~KernelFit() { if (m) delete[] m; if (b) delete [] b;
00157                  if (convolutions) delete [] convolutions;
00158                  if (BestImageStamps) delete BestImageStamps;
00159                  if (ConvolvedBest) delete ConvolvedBest;
00160                       }
00161 
00162 
00163 /* fitting routines */
00164 void KernelsFill(); /* compute the kernels constituting the basis */
00165 void AllocateConvolvedStamps(); /* trick to avoid allocation and deallocation of a big memory chunk. 
00166                                  triggered when needed */
00167 void DeallocateConvolvedStamps();
00168 
00170 void ComputeMAndB();
00172 void OneStampMAndB(const Stamp &Astamp, double *StampM, double *StampB); 
00174 void SubtractStampFromMAndB(Stamp& AStamp); 
00176 int Solve();
00177 double StampChi2(Stamp &stamp, double VSky, double InvGain); /* involves a kernel computation and a stamp convolution */
00178   double chi2;
00179   int NStampsUsed() const {return BestImageStamps->size();}
00180 
00181 /* computes chi2 contributions of stamps and applies median filtering for outliers removal. iterates until
00182 the number of stamps involved stabilizes. */
00183 void FilterStamps(); 
00185 int DoTheFit(const BaseStarList &List, double &BestSeeing, double &WorstSeeing);
00186 int DoIt(const BaseStarList &List, double &BestSeeing, double &WorstSeeing);
00187 
00188 /* computes the kernel at the given location according to the present solution */
00189 void KernCompute(Kernel &Result, const double X, const double Y) const; 
00190 
00191 
00192 void BestImageConvolve(int UpdateKernStep = 100);
00193 
00194 Image *VarianceConvolve(const Image &Source, int UpdateKern = 100);
00195 
00196 };
